title: Les Baux

thumbnail.alt_text: A work made of oil on canvas.

credit_line: Gift of Claire and Albert Arenberg Fund
publication_history:
John I. H. Baur, Loren MacIver, I. Rice Pereira, exh. cat. (New York: Whitney Museum of American Art, 1953), 33, 35, cat. 56.

James Fitzsimmons, Two Women in a Double Retrospective at The Whitney, The Art Digest, 27, no. 8 (Jan. 15, 1953): 7. 

“Recent Additions to the Twentieth Century Collections,” The Art Institute of Chicago Quarterly XLIX, (Apr. 1 1955), 24. 

John I. H. Baur, Nature in Abstraction: The Relationship of Abstract Painting and Sculpture to Nature in Twentieth Century American Art (New York: Whitney Museum of American Art, 1958), 6, 20 (ill.).

Paintings in The Art Institute of Chicago (Chicago: The Art Institute of Chicago, 1961), 263.

Biennale di Venezia, Catalogo della XXXI Esposizione Biennale Internazionale d’Arte Venezia, exh. cat. (Venice: Ente Autonomo "La Biennale di Venezia,” 1962), 219, cat. 17.

XXXI Biennale, Venezia 1962 Stati Uniti d’America 2 Pittori, 2 Sculptori (New York: The Museum of Modern Art, 1962), n.p., cat. 18.

John I. H. Baur, ed., New Art in America: Fifty Painters of the 20th Century (Greenwich, CT: New York Graphic Society, 1957), 259 (ill.)

Vincent Price, The Vincent Price Treasury of American Art (Waukesha, WI: Country Beautiful Corp., 1972), 276 (color ill.).
exhibition_history:
New York, Whitney Museum of American Art, Loren MacIver, I. Rice Pereira, Jan. 8–Mar. 1, 1953, cat. 56; Des Moines Art Center, Mar. 16–Apr. 19, 1953; San Francisco Museum of American Art, May 4–June 4, 1953; Dallas Museum of Fine Arts, June 21–July 12, 1953.

The Arts Club of Chicago, Paintings: MacIver, Nov. 4–Dec. 1, 1953, cat. 12

New York, Whitney Museum of American Art, Nature in Abstraction, Jan. 14–Mar. 16, 1958, no cat. no. 

Venice, XXXI Esposizione Internazionale d’Arte Venezia, June 16–Oct. 7, 1962, cat. 17 (cat. 18 in 2 Pittori, 2 Sculptori)

Washington DC, The White House, The White House Festival of The Arts, June 14 (extended to June 15), 1965, cat. 25; Washington DC, National Gallery of Art, The White House Festival of the Arts Foundation, June 19–July 11, 1965.
provenance_text: The artist; Pierre Matisse Gallery, New York, by Jan. 1953 [verso label and documentation in curatorial file]; sold to the Art Institute of Chicago, Dec. 14, 1953.
